description: Conductor API use cast or spawn_n to start async tasks such as rebuild_instance() and unshelve_instance(). Since no caller is waiting for a response, there is no reason for them to raise exceptions if anything goes wrong.
title: Async conductor tasks should not raise exceptions

comments.content:
Other than bloating the conductor log with tracebacks for perfectly valid conditions, the exceptions are basically no-ops in that they go nowhere.

The intention was merely to cleanup a few causes of irrelevant tracebacks from ending up in the conductor log as the failure conditions are expected and also being logged.
